gurmukhi: jYsy eyk cItI pwCY kot cItI clI jwiq iek tk pg fg mig swvDwn hY
transliteration: Jaisay Ayk Cheetee Paachhai Kot Cheetee Chalee Jaati , Ik Tak Pag Dag Magi Saavadhaan Hai ?
translation: Just as millions of ants follow the path blazed by an ant, walk on it very attentively without faltering a step;

gurmukhi: jYsy kUMj pwiq BlI BwNiq swNiq shj mY aufq AwkwscwrI AwgY Agvwn hY
transliteration: Jaisay Koonj Paati Bhalee Bhaanti Saanti Sahaj Mai , Udat Aakaasachaaree Aagai Agavaan Hai ?
translation: Just as cranes fly in a disciplined formation very cautiously in peace and patience and all of them are led by one crane;

gurmukhi: jYsy miRgmwl cwl clq tlq nwih jqR qqR AgRBwgI rmq qq iDAwn hY
transliteration: Jaisay Mrigamaal Chaal Chalat Talat Naahi , Jatr Tatr Agrabhaagee Ramat Tat Dhiaan Hai ?
translation: Just as a herd of deers never stagger from their sharp march following their leader and all proceed so very attentively,

gurmukhi: kItI Kg miRg snmuK pwCY lwgy jwih pRwnI gur pMQ Cwf clq AigAwn hY ]413]
transliteration: Keetee Khag Mrig Sanamoukh Paachhai Laagay Jaahi , Praanee Gur Pand Chhaad Chalat Agiaan Hai ?413?
translation: Ants, cranes and deers keep following their leader, but supreme leader of all the species who leaves the well defined path of the True Guru, is surely a fool and a highly ignorant person.  (413)
